description: Installation of the air source heat pumps
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):  	1025-EC-PL-02 Block Plan and Existing Site Plan, 1025-EC-PL-03 Proposed Site Plan, 1025-EC-PL-04 Existing Site Plan Enlargement, 1025-EC-PL-05 Proposed Site Plan Enlargement, 1025-EC-PL-06 Existing and Proposed Elevations Sheet 1, 1025-EC-PL-07 Existing and Proposed Elevations Sheet 2, 1025-EC-PL-08 Proposed Acoustic Enclosure Details, dated 28.11.2023 , PSDS 3A Evergreen Court Rev 00 Acoustic Enclosure, dated 10.08.2023, NOICO Noise Report, dated 07.07.2023
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The plant enclosure for the Air Source Heat Pumps shall be constructed to the specifications that are recommended by NOICO in their report ref. 2207066-8/05_v3, dated 7 July 2023. The mitigation measures and sound insulation performance of the enclosure and plant installation shall ensure that the recommended noise limits are not exceeded, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises, in accordance with the NOICO assessment and BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity, as proposed.

Reason:   To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policy D14 of The London Plan (2021) and policy 7B of Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policy D14 of The London Plan (2021) and policy 7B of Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).
